item.title: Bain Drops Out of Insignia Takeover Bid, CC Capital Talks Go On
item.description: Insignia Financial Ltd. said Bain Capital is not proceeding with a takeover offer and talks are ongoing with CC Capital Partners.
item.dc:creator: Adam Haigh

media:content.media:description: Cranes stand in Melbourne, Australia, on Tuesday, Sept. 1, 2020. A twin-speed economy is developing in Australia and posing a challenge for the central bank, as Chinese demand for iron ore buoys the resource-rich west while eastern states struggle with Covid-19 outbreaks and border closures. Photographer: Carla Gottgens/Bloomberg

item.title: Asia Stocks Set to Extend Rally as Trade War Cools: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stocks in Asia are poised to extend this week’s rebound after US benchmarks wiped out 2025’s losses on signs that President Donald Trump’s trade war is cooling and as inflation data showed limited impacts so far.
item.dc:creator: Rob Verdonck

media:content.media:description: Stock information displayed at the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX) in Sydney, Australia, on Monday, May 5, 2025. After winning a majority in parliament with the strongest mandate since World War II, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's center-left government now has the best chance in years to take the hard steps economists have called for to ignite growth.

item.title: CFTC Blasted in Court for ‘Bad Faith’ Misconduct in Fraud Case
item.description: A federal judge in New Jersey is weighing an unusual recommendation to sanction the US Commodity Futures Trading Commission, based on a report that the derivatives watchdog made such significant missteps in a 2023 fraud case that the agency should dismiss it and pay legal fees.
item.dc:creator: Nicola M White

media:content.media:description: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission headquarters in Washington, DC, US, on Friday, Dec. 23, 2022. The collapse of the FTX crypto exchange adds urgency to a Washington push to transform the CFTC into a top crypto watchdog, according to the head of the derivatives regulator.

item.title: No-Fee Banking Startup Chime Financial Files Publicly for IPO
item.description: Chime Financial Inc. filed publicly for an initial public offering, joining a growing number of candidates looking to go public in the brief window before the typical summer lull.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes, Paige Smith, Katie Roof

item.title: JBS Profits Jump as Chicken More Than Offsets Beef Downturn
item.description: JBS SA said quarterly profits rose more than expected, with chicken making up for the bulk of the increase as the world’s largest meat supplier faces deepening losses at its US beef business.
item.dc:creator: Gerson Freitas Jr, Clarice Couto

media:content.media:description: The JBS Greeley meatpacking facility in Greeley, Colorado, US, on Friday, Feb. 28, 2025. Plans for the biggest deportations in US history threaten to upend the meatpacking industry. Photographer: Chet Strange/Bloomberg

item.title: Coinbase to Join S&P 500 Next Week
item.description: Coinbase Global Inc., the largest US cryptocurrency exchange, will be added to the S&P 500 Index in the latest milestone for the booming digital-asset industry. The company will replace Discover Financial Services in the index prior to the start of trading on May 19, S&P Dow Jones Indices said in a press release. Shares of Coinbase were up 13% in after-hours trading. The inclusion of Coinbase is viewed as a vindication by crypto faithfuls who helped President Donald Trump win the election in November. “It’s a sign of the times,” said Dan Dolev, senior payments analyst at Mizuho. “It’s the welcoming of crypto stocks to mainstream.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Levin on Deploying Capital, Tariff Wars, Private Markets
item.description: Sculptor Capital Chief Investment Officer Jimmy Levin speaks on the opportunity to deploy capital, the impact of trade tensions and the growth of private markets. He speaks with Sonali Basak at the Milken Institute Global Conference. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Roth: Chaotic Month for Small Businesses
item.description: Carol Roth, Author of "You Will Own Nothing" speaks with Alix Steel and Romaine Bostick about small business sentiment outlook on Bloomberg "The Close". (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Arbor Realty Bundles Rental Loans in Its First CLO Deal Since 2022
item.description: Arbor Realty Trust Inc. is returning to securitization markets for the first time in three years as it looks to package up loans secured by apartment rental properties.
item.dc:creator: Scott Carpenter

item.title: China Birth Rate Plans Boost New Zealand’s Top-Performing Stock
item.description: China’s plans to lift its birth rate have helped a2 Milk Co.’s stock become the biggest gainer in New Zealand this year.
item.dc:creator: Carmeli Argana

media:content.media:description: A child rides a scooter at a park in Beijing.

item.title: Stocks Erase 2025 Drop as Nvidia Powers Tech Rally: Markets Wrap
item.description: A rally in the world’s largest technology companies wiped out the stock market’s losses for the year on bets tensions around Donald Trump’s trade war are cooling, with inflation data showing limited impacts thus far.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

item.title: S&P 500 Erases 2025 Losses as Ebbing Inflation Buoys Optimism
item.description: A rally powered by the world’s largest technology companies put US stocks higher on the year, as traders cheered a pause in the global trade war and signs of easing inflation.
item.dc:creator: Jess Menton

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: Latin American Assets Rally as Softer US Inflation Spurs Risk On
item.description: Latin American currencies rallied on Tuesday, outperforming their emerging markets peers, after a softer-than-expected US inflation print stoked investor optimism.
item.dc:creator: Leda Alvim, Andras Gergely

item.title: Dollar’s Big Bounce Meets a Wall of Doubt in Options Market
item.description: A Bloomberg gauge of the dollar capped its worst day in more than a month, paring Monday’s advance as traders doubted the durability of the currency’s surge on the back of easing US-China trade tensions.
item.dc:creator: Vassilis Karamanis

item.title: Options Traders Abandon Fed Rate-Cut Bets on Tariff Optimism
item.description: Traders are rushing out of bets that call for Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts as the US-China trade war cools and the latest read on inflation reveals subdued tariff impact.
item.dc:creator: Edward Bolingbroke

media:content.media:description: Containers are loaded onto trucks at the Port of Houston in Seabrook, Texas.

item.title: Stocks Erase 2025 Drop on Tech Rally | Closing Bell
item.description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Alix Steel, Scarlet Fu, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Vertical Aerospace Develops Hybrid in Move Toward Defense
item.description: Vertical Aerospace CEO Stuart Simpson explains the eVTOL company’s plans for a hybrid-electric aircraft aimed at the defense sector, and why it is hoping to secure a strategic investor. Simpson speaks with Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Investors Embracing Risk Even as Uncertainty Lingers
item.description: Fiona Cincotta, senior analyst at City Index, says the market is not quite out of the woods, as trade uncertainty still lingers. She discusses the impact of Nvidia’s Saudi chip deal with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Premium for August T-Bills Flags Early Anxiety Around X-Date
item.description: Treasury bills investors are starting to maneuver around those securities maturing in August after Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told lawmakers that the US is likely to exhaust its borrowing authority that month if the federal debt ceiling isn’t raised or suspended by then. His warning has sent bill rates rising.
item.dc:creator: Alex Harris

media:content.media:description: The US Treasury Department building in Washington, DC, US, on Saturday, May 10, 2025. The legislative push for President Donald Trump's massive tax package will begin in earnest next week as key House committees consider the legislation despite lingering divisions among Republicans.

item.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq 100 Erase 2025 Drop as Trade Hope Sparks Rebound
item.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 indexes turned higher for the year on Tuesday, reversing multi-trillion dollar routs, as enthusiasm for US stocks grows with global trade tensions cooling after the Trump administration and China agreed to temporarily lower tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Esha Dey

item.title: Generac Rethinking Supply Chain Amid Tariffs, CEO Jagdfeld Says
item.description: Generac Chair and CEO Aaron Jagdfeld says the company is rethinking its supply chain amid the Trump administration's tariffs. Speaking on "Bloomberg The Close," Jagdfeld also discusses data center demand and Generac's international expansion. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: L’Oreal Sells $1 Billion of Bonds in Firm’s US Market Debut
item.description: L’Oreal SA sold $1 billion of investment-grade notes on Tuesday — the cosmetics company’s first deal in the US corporate bond market.
item.dc:creator: Ethan M Steinberg

item.title: US Bonds Rise as Soft Inflation Backs Bets on Two 2025 Fed Rate Cuts
item.description: Treasury debt slipped as gains for US stocks reinforced the broadening conviction on Wall Street that Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts are unlikely before December.
item.dc:creator: Liz Capo McCormick

media:content.media:description: The Marriner S. Eccles Federal Reserve building in Washington, DC.

item.title: Coinbase to Join S&P 500 Next Week
item.description: Coinbase Global Inc., the largest US cryptocurrency exchange, will be added to the S&P 500 Index in the latest milestone for the booming digital-asset industry. The company will replace Discover Financial Services in the index prior to the start of trading on May 19. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Bitcoin Movement a Pain Trade: Crucible’s Demirors
item.description: Crucible Capital, Group General Partner Founder Meltem Demirors discusses the price of Bitcoin as it correlates to stocks. She speaks with Tim Stenovec and Sonali Basal on “Bloomberg Crypto.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump Memecoin Dinner Contest Lures Traders From Outside US
item.description: President Trump’s upcoming memecoin dinner has been highly controversial and subject of calls for an inquiry from Democrats in Congress. Memecoin holders were encouraged to register with the coin's website and to keep average holdings up, with the top 220 promised a dinner with Trump on May 22. That competition ended on Monday. Bloomberg's Anthony Cormier reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Saks Hires Kirkland & Ellis, PJT to Study Financing Options
item.description: Saks Global Enterprises tapped Kirkland & Ellis, PJT Partners and Bank of America Corp. to help it explore ways to raise new financing alongside the asset-based loan it is pursuing, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.
item.dc:creator: Eliza Ronalds-Hannon

media:content.media:description: A shopper carries a Saks Fifth Avenue bag in New York, US, on Thursday, April 11, 2024. The US Census Bureau is scheduled to release retail sales figures on April 15. Photographer: Yuki Iwamura/Bloomberg

item.title: Ex-Viking CIO’s Hedge Fund Expected to Top $1 Billion in Debut
item.description: Former Viking Global Investors Chief Investment Officer Ning Jin is expected to have at least $1 billion of client cash when he opens his global stock hedge fund in the fourth quarter, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Katherine Burton

media:content.media:description: Ning Jin Photographer: Kevin Dietsch/Getty Images

item.title: Ukraine, US Sign Additional Documents on Implementing Minerals Deal
item.description: Ukraine and the US have signed additional agreements concerning a natural resources deal, a key demand of US President Donald Trump which is crucial for sustaining military aid for Kyiv.
item.dc:creator: Volodymyr Verbianyi

media:content.media:description: A dump truck shifts iron ore from an excavation site near Horishni Plavni, Ukraine.

item.title: Oil Rises as Trump Threatens Iranian Crude If Nuclear Deal Fails
item.description: Oil continued to rebound from the year’s lows as US President Donald Trump threatened to ramp up sanctions against Iranian crude if a nuclear deal with the OPEC member isn’t reached.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis
